channel.title: Symbols on Codewrecks
channel.description: Recent content in Symbols on Codewrecks

item.title: Unable to expose Symbol Server with IIS
item.description: Sadly enough, I verified in these years that many people using TFS ignore what a symbol server is. For all those readers that does not know what a symbol server is, I suggest to read my previous article that explains how to manage a symbol server on Azure or on-premises VM with TFS and IIS. Recently I’ve got some feedback from people that were not able to setup everything correctly when is time to expose Symbol Server with IIS.

item.title: Deploy AspNET web site on IIS from TFS Build
item.description: In the last article of the series, I dealt with Deploying on Azure Web Sites from on-premise TFS, but the very same technique can be used to automatically deploy from a standard TFS Build to a standard Web Site hosted in IIS and not in Azure. For this demo I’ve prepared a VM on azure, but the configuration is the very same if the VM is on-premise or if you use a physical machine to run IIS.
